All Chairmen of Committees Sub-Committees
FROM; Harry J. Skornia
DATE; January 29, 19b0
SUBJECT: Comuiittoe function, definition, and structure revision,,
For the past several years it has been obvious that, .although, the
very foundations of the strengths of the NAEH must of necessity lie
in committees -- as the most practical way of identifying and organ¬
izing talents, problems and solutions on a national basis, and fre¬
quently conducting or supervising necessary studies and advising on
staff efforts, this potential has never been more than minimally
realizedo
Pm sure that there are scores, if not hundreds, of fine people, who
would be glad to help, or who are being used as square pegs in round
holeso
I feel that committees also should offer individuals opportunities for
realizing their best talents, achieving recognition nationally for both
themselves and the NAEH, and providing a channel for their influence
and talents to be exerted in a broader arena than would otherwise be
available*
In the interim since ray election, X have not had the time to do this*
November and December (and now January) have been riddled with trips
and meetings. Even though I have consulted with each proposed chair¬
man, with the chairman of the Hoard, the NAEB staff, and various others
on committee appointments* this year*s committees, once again, are
having to be appointed with less knowledge and care than they deserve
and need* I feel this must not occur again*
Therefore, 1 need^from each of you, your best reactions to the mater
rials and problems presented here* Let me say, before I go farther
that I do plan to mail to every member of the NAEB, later on (after
receiving your reactions) a statement on NAEB Committees, a revision
of the committee definition list attached, and a request for each
person to state his committee area interest, willingness to serve,
special talents, etc.
